# react-terminal-typewriter

> A lightweight React hook for terminal-style typewriter effects with cursor animation, loop support, and full TypeScript support. Zero dependencies, ~1KB minified.

## Installation

```bash
npm install react-terminal-typewriter
```

## Quick Start

```tsx
import { useTypewriter } from 'react-terminal-typewriter'

function App() {
  const { displayText, cursorBlinkSpeed } = useTypewriter({
    text: 'Hello, World!',
    delay: 100,
    loop: true
  })

  return <h1>{displayText}</h1>
}
```

## API Reference

### Options

- `text` (string, required): Text to type
- `delay` (number, default: 100): Delay between typing each character (ms)
- `startDelay` (number, default: 500): Delay before starting to type (ms)
- `loop` (boolean, default: false): Enable loop mode
- `loopDelay` (number, default: 2000): Delay before starting to delete (ms)
- `deleteDelay` (number, default: 50): Delay between deleting each character (ms)
- `cursorBlinkSpeed` (number, default: 800): Cursor blink animation speed (ms)

### Return Values

- `displayText` (string): Current displayed text
- `isTyping` (boolean): Whether currently typing
- `isDeleting` (boolean): Whether currently deleting
- `isComplete` (boolean): Whether typing is complete (only when loop is false)
- `cursorBlinkSpeed` (number): Cursor blink speed for CSS variable
